title: [Neuroscience] Newly identified biomarkers may detect early cognitive decline via blood test. Future blood tests may be able to detect the condition earlier in people whose cells are aging early due to stressors like psychiatric disorders or childhood maltreatment.

[Neuroscience] Serotonin loss may contribute to cognitive decline in the early stages of Alzheimer's disease. Relatively lower levels of the 'happiness' chemical, serotonin, in parts of the brain of those with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) may play a role in memory problems including Alzheimer's disease.
